newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: ANA to grow international passenger revenue.
newsitem.headline: ANA to grow international passenger revenue.

text.p: All Nippon Airways (ANA)is looking to increase its international passenger revenue by eight percent annually, a company official said on Friday.

"(Where) this fiscal year is concerned, our international revenue is expected to be 154 billion yen and we plan to grow this by eight percent annually for the next three years," said managing director of sales and marketing Osamu Nagahata at a press briefing in Singapore
ANA is looking for its international revenue to make up 35 percent of its total revenue, he said.
"Domestic revenue is increasing at the same time...fiscal 1998 is our hope (to reach the 35 percent target)," he said.
The airline expects its international capacity to grow by another 18 percent for the fiscal year ending March 1996, after rising 24 percent in the previous year, said Nagahata.

ANA announced it was increasing its services from Singapore to Tokyo to five weekly from four and has relaunched its first class flights on this route. It is increasing Bangkok to Tokyo flights to six per week from four, Kuala Lumpur to Osaka flights to six per week from five. These flight increases will take place from this month.
ANA reported a net income of 3.09 billion yen for the fiscal year ended March 1996 on a operating revenue of 846 billion yen.
Officials said ANA had a average load factor of about 70 percent on its international routes.
